title: is THIS bannable? Ranked Solo Queue
body: i pretty much couldn't go bot after that, so we lost. I ended up being the one who got reported. gg...

replies.body: Yes I would suggest you submit a ticket about it. This is a form of trolling that is being used in korea to de-rank.
You understand you can chose where to be spit out right?? This is entirely your fault. Why did you choose to get spit forward? It's not reportable.
You do realize tahm ate him and walked towards the enemy intentionally? How is it his fault his teammate is dragging him into the enemy bot lane? Are you serious?

you CANT click out of tahm and you CANT choose the direction. Not even Tahm can cancel his W early. it has a set duration period and spits in the direction Tahm is facing. Period.

This isn't Kalista Ult, this is Tahm W. different rules people.

lmao but you can choose the direction? xD literally just point your mouse in the direction you want to go and i think right click, and also you cant exit right away, but you can exit earlier than you normally would if you just let the ability go by itself.

This only applies after you've been in Tahm's belly for longer than the minimum time. From the time he eats you until that time, you're helpless and Tahm gets to choose your exit direction since he's given priority first in that situation. Basically if Tahm eats you then spams W, he gets the first say as to where you're going and there isn't anything you can do about it.

The "minimum time" portion of your post is correct; however, Tahm does not have priority when spitting out a champion. If the person inside of Tahm is clicking to escape, they'll be able to get out in the direction they want regardless of where the Tahm wants to spit them out.

-Sincerely, a Tahm Kench main.

> and also you cant exit right away, but you can exit earlier than you normally would if you just let the ability go by itself.

Oh really? because the last time i got ate by a kench (yesterday) i couldn't choose when to get out.

just spam click the direction you want to go. unless he is also doing that you will win every time cause lag. or lag isnt on your side and you dont . . . either way its something that sometimes work and helps
Also note this only works when an ally of TK is eaten by TK.  If you're an enemy, there's nothing you can do.
it is bannable , and if I was from Riot , I would have also banned twich and blitz for being a non-sportsmanlike players , they should understand that your support is trolling !
Well then good thing you don't work at Riot, because Blitzcrank and Twitch did nothing wrong.
nah, he didnt say any mean words in chat, so according to RIOT, hes a good guy.

"He was just having a bad game. Tahm is a very difficult champion to master and the player made a small mistake. It is YOUR fault for not getting out of Tahm's mouth. This could have been prevented many ways, but you chose to stay in lane with 1% health to be greedy. I just hope you did not flame Tahm for his mistakes."

~Riot
my god the straw man arguments lately

It's more or less a fact though.

It apparently takes weeks of negatively affecting games through gameplay and getting reported in over 50% of your games (re: Smite Nunu and support Singed) over the system picking up a couple of toxic buzzwords (n-word, homophobic slur, kys) across significantly fewer games.

Raoul's posts is satirical, but it is a very real biased issue.

can confirm. a guy was playing draven for the first time in norms and asks "how do i play this champion" my entire teams response is just tyler 1 things. "got to say hehexd everytime you get a kill. gotta int a kill if you get KSed. you NEED to be super toxic in all chat. give us the fucking roast man. gotta be alpha as fuck and run in 1v5. if you dont get a penta blame your support"

the guy got chat banned for 14 games even though he was memeing (we ENCOURAGED him to meme. we let the enemy team know he was memeing. they still reported him) felt bad for him
Impersonating T1 in League is like impersonating Hitler in Austria/Germany

its not a strawman argument at all, its whats happening in this game. 
Trolls and feeders are going wild and nothing happens. But once they manage to trigger people, those who call them out are baned.

The flash tho xD

Anyways to answer your question yes if you send a report or ticket to Riot, best thing to always do when reporting someone is to include a video like this in the "additional info" section, if not send a direct ticket.

At the amounts of reports that are registered daily, you really think someone would actually look for at that additional info ? XD

Riot doesnt give a crap about extra details, they just set an algorythm.   They aren't doing anything
Which is why I also suggested sending an actual ticket where you can request you know.. an actual human to look at the case.
Tickets are also handled by robots at first.
Then you can request a human after if you aren't satisfied.
Lol rekt m8!! Btw you can click yourself out of tahm so, kinda your fault tbh.
umm. no, you REALLY can't click yourself out of tahm. I don't know if sarcasm or what but EVERYONE knows you cant click out of tahm. Lucian did nothing wrong here.
I also agree, tahm was trolling and what not, but you can choose the direction you're spit out when tahm eats you, and you can also click out of it before it actually ends.
^ your comment has to be sarcasm right? Because if not I'm worried about you.
How did you get away with that name lmao. I'm dying.
Because riot is busy with LC$ most of the time
How are their still people that don't know u have prioty for the exit whenever an allied tahm me eats you
you're absolutely wrong and I'm surprised how little of people have ever even played tahm or played with tahm. you can click out.

> [{quoted}](name=Wimbledofy,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=pRGGRz5z,comment-id=000a00000003,timestamp=2017-08-24T06:30:07.965+0000)
>
> you're absolutely wrong and I'm surprised how little of people have ever even played tahm or played with tahm. you can click out.

but u cant click out instantly
Yes. That is griefing/trolling
Maybe they should have a setting where it is like button for dj sona music but instead is for allowing Tahm to eat you. Idk what else to say.

it is. it's just sad that Riot Tantrum will probably not even look at this, or come up with some reason like "oh I see this stuff 100 times a day and blah blah blah" 

but this is the example of Negative behavior. He intentionally ate the lucian, intentionally set him up to die and Intentionally did not help one bit to save.

i see this stuff happen in ranked games all the time, and it's sad that people can do this type of stuff and they are either not banned, or riots instant feedback system doesn't kick off til an hour or two later (had that happen before to a guy I reported who was very toxic in an URF) 

What's even more sad is that you won't be able to get that LP back if you lost the game because of his antics. You just have to hope you win your next game to get BACK to nill on your rank and mmr and go from there... Something I personally think riot should look into during the pre season.
Any update on this situation? How did Player Support respond?
that's pretty much the definition of griefing...

While I don't know if the choosing part in spitting is true since I haven't experienced this myself, even if it were the case, this tahm should be receiving steps towards a warning/ban anyway. You're basically down a person because their only goal is trying to kill another player on their team. I guess they should be rewarded though instead. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

Absolutely! The moment I saw Tahm grab Lucian at low heath and throwing him at the enemy team that's the straw that broke the camel's back.

{{champion:163}}
OH YES IT IS

It's trolling in its finest moment. Like a fine glass of wine got spilled on fine silk that you use to wipe your ass with that you then handed to your girlfriend to blow her nose with. But that being said you coulda gotten out of his mouth whenever you wanted.
Yeah, it's reportable, but here on the forums it will be taken down for name and shame. Send it through a support ticket instead.
His name is raging troll, im guessing we didnt see what was said on chat before this to make the tahm do that.
That's dumb. Regardless of what was said, you report, you don't int (or in this situation, force your teammate into a situation where they WILL die)

Action is no less meaningless than reaction. If I punch you in the face and your reaction is to punch me in the face, it is the same as calling someone down and getting punched in the face for it. What was said in the chat is relevant.

If you were harassing someone and they punched you in the face for it, they can still be prosecuted for assault. They should've filed a report for harassment, not gone and punched you in the face.

Reacting in this way makes you no different than the person who is harassing you. If it's really a case where the lucian was toxic, than tahm reacting the way he did immediatley makes his case that much harder to justify.

...and now we're into the philosophical argument as to why the side which ends a confrontation is not always the guilty party. In the case of an assault, it could have been an ongoing case of harassment which demoralized the assailant to the point of fearing to speak to authorities which finally led to a point where enough was enough and a physical blow incurred in an attempt to curb the harassment and strike fear into the harasser in order to stop the abuse. This can be applied in this situation as well where Lucian may have been continually harassing Tahm and because of previous 'reports' that have gone unheard and the flawed reporting system in itself Tahm was forced to take swift action to curb the abuse and change the tides of the interaction to save himself.

That's all a load of shit of course, but my point is that the instigator is often overlooked as the root cause of the interaction after one party attempts to solve the problem in the moment because of outside factors that may have led them to believe that is the only course of action. Punishing the person for turning around and punching the harasser in the face does not solve future occurrences of this happening, it only reinforces the harassers behaviour to create another similar situation in the future without penalty.

I can't argue with that reasoning. It's no secret that the punishment system is not perfect. On any note, the analogy was dumb regardless, from beginning to end. Either way, nothing was said in chat from the time the video started to the time it ended, (by the way, it's still extremely early in the game) I don't understand what could've been so harassing and terrible that was said or done that "justifies" the actions of the player in question.
Yup he deserves a ban
